Questions.Question: According to the lesson, what impressed Maya (the investor) about BookShelf's new architecture?
Options: The application ran faster than before
How easily a mobile API could be added without changing business logic
The use of the latest JavaScript framework
Questions.Explanation: Maya was impressed that adding mobile app support (a new driving adapter) didn't require changing any business logic - just adding a new adapter that calls the same use cases.

Questions.Question: According to the lesson, Chen's on-premise requirement was solved by adding SQLite as an alternative driven adapter for the BookRepository port.
Questions.Explanation: Chen needed on-premise deployment with a different database. Sam created an SQLite adapter implementing the same BookRepository port, allowing on-premise deployment without changing business logic.

Questions.Question: According to the 'Complete Picture' section, which of the following are benefits Sam gained from Hexagonal Architecture? Select ALL that apply.
Options: Testability - domain can be tested without infrastructure
Flexibility - swap adapters without changing business logic
Maintainability - clear boundaries make changes safer
Questions.Explanation: The three core benefits are testability, flexibility, and maintainability. Database query speed is determined by the adapter implementation, not the architecture pattern itself.

Questions.Question: According to the Common Pitfalls section, putting business logic in HTTP handlers instead of the domain is called having an _______ domain model.
Questions.Explanation: An anemic domain model has entities that are just data containers, with all logic in services or handlers. This scatters business rules and breaks encapsulation.
